actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 101-662.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 407.
Mr. Anderson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-449.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: To amend the John F. Kennedy Center Act to authorize appropriations for maintenance, repair, alteration and other services necessary for the John F. Kenndy Center for the Performing Arts, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the John F. Kennedy Center Act to require the Secretary of the Interior to provide for the repair and alteration of the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts. Requires the Secretary and the Board of Trustees for the Center to enter into an agreement setting forth mutual responsibilities for the provision of services for operating the building. Authorizes appropriations for FY 1991 and 1992 for annual and deferred maintenance, repairs, and alterations of the Center. Revises provisions with respect to the auditing of the accounts of the Center by the General Accounting Office to: (1) require that such audits be conducted at least once every three years; and (2) specify that the purposes of such audits are to examine the expenditures and determine the continuing ability of the Center to pay its share of future expenditures under such agreement.

titles.title: To amend the John F. Kennedy Center Act to authorize appropriations for maintenance, repair, alteration and other services necessary for the John F. Kenndy Center for the Performing Arts, and for other purposes.
